PROFESSIONAL PROFILE  
As a qualified project manager , I bring a distinct blend of rolling stock and aircraft maintenance experience 
(20 years), providing technical leadership in completing corrective and preventative maintenance regimes and 
administering complex fault -finding repairs:  
➢ Human Factors integ ration processes and standards: profound understanding including identification 
of error chains and ability to analyse existing work -flows systems to identify and implement operational 
improvements   
 ➢ Resource and financial control: strong understanding d emonstrated throughout the project lifecycle, 
effectively tracking all requirements as project lead to ensure smooth delivery and resolve problems 
identified in the integration and test phase  while delivering sustainable and profitable business growth  
 ➢ Contract management: proficient in the administration of requisite tools and procedures and positive 
compliance with the managing of the risks and opportunities process   
 ➢ Service & operational innovation: ability to apply rail transport models to develop innovative and 
realistic outcomes that meet technical standards, customer requirements, and commercial obligation s 
 ➢ Lecturing and mentoring : increased student engagement and interaction by incorporating collaborative 
learning that resulted in my n omination for New Horizon Award (2005). Mentored new Aviation faculty 
as the College took advantage of my aviation background to introduce NCFE Level 2 courses   
 ➢ Business -facing skills: driving continuous improvements in  technical and  business performance across a 
wide range of financial and non -financial metrics and KPIs  
 ➢ Communication & interpersonal skills: highly develop in presenting to coherent analysis and  
persuasion using appropriate tools  
➢ Stakeholder relationships: effec tive management at all levels of the business to ensure  
requirements are aligned  
 
RELEVANT QUALIFICATIONS  
BSc Rail Operations Management (Glasgow Caledonian University) MSc Project Management (Robert Gordon 
University)  Certified as Project Management Professional (PMP) from PMI Certified as Associate Project 
Management Professional (APMP) from APM  
 

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  
Bombardier Transportation , UK LIMITED , Derby   Jan 2019 – Current   
Asset Management Engineer  
Contracted with responsibility  
▪ Project execution to optimize the maintenance regime of fleets under Bombardier’s responsibility  
▪ Plan and coordinate the activities required to deliver those strategies including leading customer 
liaison meetings, facilitating supplier involvement and VAB/ICP reviews  
▪ Ability to Implement and manage reliability centered maintenance and condition -based  maintenance 
activities  
▪ To develop risk assessments and business cases to support optimization of work packa ges under 
review , with one project en route to reduce equipment downtime by 20% in first year . 
▪ Undertake component condition assessments to support the development and improvement of rolling 
stock maintenance regimes  
▪ Ensure that LCCs are optimized, equitab ly balanced between, cost, down time and  
reliability, whilst ensuring that product and operational safety are not compromised  
▪  Providing technical and specialist consultancy skills for Rolling Stock Maintenance , Overhaul processes  
and project lifecycles of Maintenance work packages  
 
Governor – Local Governing Board Redden Court Secondary School  
2018 - Current  
▪ Volunteer position, I have responsibility as part of the Board, for raising school achievement, by 
ensuring the school maintains clarity of vision to its core values of Commitment to Success for All 
▪ Holding school Heads of  Departments to their stated strategic core values  
▪ Holding  the head teacher accountable for the financial and educational performance of the school
